intro: Calcitrapa stellata, commonly known as starry calcitrapa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Calcitrapa stellata is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate, star-shaped blooms.
